recipe_name: How To Sprout Vaal, Lima Beans
recipe_long_name: How To Sprout Vaal, Lima Beans recipe - How to make How To Sprout Vaal, Lima Beans
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups vaal (field beans/ butter beans)
recipe:
Method
To 
sprout vaal, (lima beans)
 place vaal in a bowl and cover with enough water. We have used 1 1/2 cups vaal to make 3 cups sprouted vaal.
Cover and soak vaal ( lima beans ) for 15 hours in plenty of warm water.
Drain.
Place the soaked and drained vaal ( lima beans ) in a damp cheese cloth and leave to sprout for 24 hours. Note that 12 hours is not enough to sprout. Ensure that there is a little bit of water at the bottom of the bowl so that the vaal will use it to sprout.
Add 1/4 cup water over the vaal and damp muslin cloth to ensure the lima beans sprout over the next 24 hours.
Tie the muslin cloth well and keep aside for 24 hours to enable sprouting. Our vaal ( butter beans, lima beans ) is now sprouted after 24 hours.
Put the sprouted vaal in a bowl full of water as we going to peel them.
Peel the sprouted vaal with your fingers.
Wash and drain the vaal. This is required as we have sprouted the beans for 24 hours.
Your 
sprouted vaal
 is ready to be use in sabzis, dal and salads.
tags:

recipe_long_name: Vegetable Khichdi, Masala Khichdi recipe - How to make Vegetable Khichdi, Masala Khichdi
ingredients:
For Vegetable Khichdi:
 1 cup wada kolum rice (chawal) , soaked for 15 minutes and drained
 1 cup yellow moong dal (split yellow gram) , soaked for 15 minutes and drained
 1/2 cup french bean cubes
 1/2 cup carrot cubes
 1/2 cup potato cubes
 1/2 cup cauliflower florets
 1/2 cup green peas
 2 tbsp ghee
 2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 6 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tbsp finely chopped garlic (lehsun)
 1/2 tsp green chilli paste
 1/2 cup finely chopped onions
 1/2 cup finely chopped tomatoes
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp shahi biryani masala
 1 1/2 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 salt to taste
 2 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 For Serving:
 ghee
 curd
 pickle
 papad
recipe:
For vegetable khichdi
Combine the rice, yellow moong dal, ½ tsp turmeric powder, salt and 3 cups of water, mix well and pressure cook for 3 whistles.
Mash it lightly and keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a deep pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the garlic, green chilli paste and onions and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the french beans, carrot, green peas, potatoes and cauliflower and sauté on a medium flame for 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the chilli powder, remaining ½ tsp of turmeric powder, shahi masala, coriander powder, salt and 2 cups of water, mix well and cover with  a lid and cook for 15 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the cooked rice-dal mixture and 3½ cups of water, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the coriander and mix well.
Serve hot with ghee, curd, pickle and papad.

recipe_long_name: Mirchi Pakora, Spicy Mirchi Pakoda recipe - How to make Mirchi Pakora, Spicy Mirchi Pakoda
ingredients:
For Mirchi Pakora:
 10 bhavnagri chillies
 To Be Mixed Into A Masala Powder:
 2 tsp chaat masala
 2 tsp freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch)
 1 tsp salt
 To Be Mixed Into A Batter (using 3/4 Cup Of Water):
 1 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 2 tbsp rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 pinches of baking soda
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp hot oil
recipe:
For mirchi pakora
To make 
mirchi pakora
, wash and clean bhavnagri chillies and make a long slit in the centre.
Carefully remove the seeds and discard them.
Stuff each chilli with little masala powder and press it lightly. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a deep non-stick pan, dip each stuffed chilli into the besan batter till it coats the chilli well and deep fry in hot oil on a slow flame till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides.
Serve the mirchi pakora immediately.

ingredients:
For Low Fat Chaas:
 1 1/2 cups low fat curds (dahi)
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method for low fat chaas
To make 
low fat chaas
, combine the curds and salt in a deep bowl and whisk well.
Add 2½ cups of chilled water and whisk well.
Serve the low fat chaas chilled.

recipe_long_name: Low Fat Healthy Gujarati Kadhi recipe - How to make Low Fat Healthy Gujarati Kadhi
ingredients:
For The Healthy Kadhi:
 2 cups low fat curds (dahi)
 5 tbsp besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 tsp ghee
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 2 pinches of asafoetida (hing)
 5 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 For The Garnish:
 2 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 For Serving With Healthy Kadhi:
 brown rice khichdi
recipe:
For the healthy kadhi
To make 
healthy kadhi
, combine the curds and besan in a deep bowl and whisk well till no lumps remain.
Add 3 cups of water and mix well and keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a kadhai and add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the asafoetida and curry leaves and sauté for a few seconds.
Add the prepared curds-besan-water mixture, salt, ginger-green chilli paste and mix well and bring to a boil for 2 minutes, while stirring continuously.
Reduce the flame and simmer for 8 to 10 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Garnish the low fat healthy  kadhi with coriander and serve hot with brown rice khichdi.

recipe_long_name: Vrat ka Dahi Vada recipe - How to make Vrat ka Dahi Vada
ingredients:
For Vrat ka Dahi Vada:
 1/2 cup sanwa millet (sama) , washed and drained
 1/2 cup roughly chopped potatoes
 1 tsp ginger (adrak) paste
 1 tsp finely chopped green chillies
 rock salt (sendha namak) to taste
 2 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 tbsp coarsely crushed peanuts
 oil for deep-frying
 1 cup whisked curd (dahi)
 1 tbsp powdered sugar
 4 tbsp sweet chutney
 8 tsp green chutney
 cumin seeds (jeera) powder for sprinkling
 4 tbsp faraali chivda
 4 tsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 4 tbsp pomegranate (anar)
recipe:
For vrat ka dahi vada
To make 
vrat ka dahi vada
, combine the curd and powdered sugar in a bowl and mix well.
In a pressure cooker, add sama, add potatoes, ginger paste, green chillies, salt and ¾ cup of water, mix well and pressure cook for 2 whistles.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid. Transfer the mixture into a bowl or plate and mash it very well. Cool slightly.
Add coriander and peanuts and mix very well to form a dough.
Divide the mixture into 16 equal portions and roll each portion into a ball.
Heat the oil in a deep pan, and deep fry a few at a time on a medium flame till they turn golden brown in colour and crisp from all the sides.
Put them in a bowl with enough warm water and allow them to soak for 5 minutes. Squeeze lightly and keep aside.
Place 4 vadas in a serving plate, put ¼ cup of curd mixture, 1 tbsp of khajur imli ki chutney, 2 tsp green chutney , sprinkle little cumin seeds powder, 1 tbsp faraali chivda, 1 tsp coriander and finally 1 tbsp pomegranate evenly over it.
Repeat step 8 make 3 more plates.
Serve immediately.

recipe_long_name: Farali Bhajiya, Suran Pakora recipe - How to make Farali Bhajiya, Suran Pakora
ingredients:
For Farali Bhajiya:
 1 cup sanwa millet (sama) flour
 1/2 cup rajgira (amaranth) flour
 1 1/2 cups peeled and grated yam
 2 1/2 tsp green chilli paste
 2 tsp grated ginger (adrak)
 1 tsp lemon juice
 1/2 cup curd (dahi)
 1/4 cup coarsely crushed peanuts
 1 tsp sugar
 rock salt (sendha namak) to taste
 1/4 cup coriander (dhania) leaves
 For Serving:
 green chutney
recipe:
For farali bhajiya
To make 
farali bhajiya
, combine all the ingredients in a deep bowl, add approx. ¼ cup water to make a batter consistency.
Heat the oil in a deep pan and drop small spoonful of the mixture into the hot oil, a few at a time.
Deep fry the bhajiyas on medium flame until they are golden brown and crisp. Drain on an absorbent paper.
Serve the farali bhajiya hot with farali green chutney.

recipe_long_name: Dabeli Brushetta recipe - How to make Dabeli Brushetta
ingredients:
For The Dabeli Topping:
 2 tbsp oil
 2 1/2 tbsp dabeli masala
 2 cups boiled and mashed potatoes
 2 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 tsp lemon juice
 salt to taste
 Other Ingredients For Dabeli Brushetta:
 18 bread slices
 18 tsp butter for cooking
 5 tsp garlic chutney
 9 tsp green chutney
 9 tsp sweet chutney
 18 tsp nylon sev
 18 tsp pomegranate (anar)
 18 tsp masala peanuts
 9 tsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
For dabeli brushetta
To make 
dabeli brushetta
, heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan. Add the dabeli masala, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the potatoes, coriander, lemon juice, salt and ½ cup of water, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally. Keep aside.
Apply 1 tsp butter on each bread slice and bake in a pre-heated oven at 180ºc (360ºf) for 15 minutes or till crisp. Keep aside.
Place a toasted bread on a clean, dry surface. Spread ¼ tsp garlic chutney and spread it evenly.
Apply ½ tsp green chutney evenly over it.
Put 1 tbsp of the prepared potato stuffing evenly over it.
Top it with ½ tsp sweet chutney.
Finally put 1 tsp sev, 1 tsp pomegranate seeds, 1 tsp masala peanuts and ½ tsp finely chopped coriander evenly over it.
Repeat steps 4 to 8 to make 17 more 
dabeli brushettas
.
Serve the dabeli brushetta immediately.

recipe_long_name: Rajgira Chivda recipe - How to make Rajgira Chivda
ingredients:
For Rajgira Chivda:
 4 cups puffed amaranth (rajgira) seeds
 2 tbsp oil
 1/2 cup raw peanuts
 1 cup sliced dry coconut (kopra)
 12 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tsp finely chopped green chillies
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
recipe:
For rajgira chivda
To make 
rajgira chivda
, heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan, add the raw peanuts and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the coconut slices and sauté on a medium flame for 1 minute.
Add the curry leaves and green chilies and sauté on a medium flame for 1 minute.
Add the turmeric powder, chilli powder and salt, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 30 seconds.
Add the puffed rajgira, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Cool down and store the 
 in an air tight container or use as require.

recipe_long_name: Stuffed Rava Dhokla recipe - How to make Stuffed Rava Dhokla
ingredients:
For Stuffed Rava Dhokla:
 1 1/2 cups semolina (rava / sooji)
 3/4 cup curd (dahi)
 1 tsp green chilli paste
 1/4 cup green chutney
 1 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 1 1/2 tsp fruit salt
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/4 tsp freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch)
 For The Tempering:
 1 tbsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
For stuffed rava dhokla
To make 
stuffed rava dhokla
, in a deep bowl, combine the semolina, curds, 1 tbsp oil, green chilli paste, salt and 1½ cups of water in a deep bowl and whisk well.
In a small bowl, remove ½ cup of batter, add green chutney and mix well.
Now divide the remaining batter into 2 equal portions.
Add ½ tsp of fruit salt in one half of the batter and gently mix it.
Pour the batter on greased plate and spread it evenly.
Steam the first layer of dhokla on medium flame for 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, add ½ tsp of fruit salt in the green chutney batter. Mix it gently and pour over the first layer of steamed dhokla.
Spread it evenly and steam on medium flame for 3 minutes.
Now add remaining ½ tsp fruit salt into the last dhokla batter and mix well.
Pour over the chutney mixed steamed dhokla and spread it evenly.
Sprinkle little black pepper and little red chilli powder evenly over the dhokla and steam further for 5 minutes or until done. Keep aside.
For the tempering
Heat the remaining 1 tbsp of oil in a small non-stick pan, add the mustard seeds, sesame seeds and asafoetida and sauté on a medium flame for 30 seconds.
Pour the tempering over the stuffed rava dhokla, sprinkle the coriander evenly over it.
Cool the rava dhokla slightly and cut into equal sized squares pieces.
Serve the stuffed rava dhokla stuffed rava dhoklas
 immediately.

recipe_long_name: Thepla Sandwich recipe - How to make Thepla Sandwich
ingredients:
To Be Mixed Into A Stuffing:
 1/4 cup finely chopped onions
 1/4 cup finely chopped capsicum
 1/4 cup finely chopped cabbage
 1/4 cup pizza sauce
 1/2 cup grated processed cheese
 5 tbsp mayonnaise
 2 tsp dry red chilli flakes (paprika)
 1 tsp dried mixed herbs
 1 tbsp fresh cream
 salt to taste
 Other Ingredients For Thepla Sandwich:
 6  methi theplas  (8” each)
 1/4 cup grated processed cheese
 For Serving With Thepla Sandwich:
 tomato ketchup
 green chutney
recipe:
For thepla sandwich
To make 
thepla sandwich
, divide the stuffing into 3 equal portions.
Place 2 theplas on a clean, dry surface.
Spread a portion of the stuffing on 1 thepla and spread it evenly.
Sandiwch it using another thepla over it and press it lightly.
Put little grated cheese evenly over it.
Cut into 4 pieces.
Repeat steps 2 to 6 to make 2 more thepla sandwiches.
Serve the thepla sandwich thepla sandwich recipe
 immediately with tomato ketchup and green chutney.

recipe_long_name: Khakhra Chaat recipe - How to make Khakhra Chaat
ingredients:
For Khakhra Chaat:
 4  ghee sada khakhra ( 8” each)
 2 tbsp tomato ketchup
 4 tbsp finely chopped onions
 4 tbsp finely chopped capsicum
 2 tbsp deseeded and finely chopped tomatoes
 4 tbsp boiled sweet corn kernels (makai ke dane)
 salt for sprinkling
 chaat masala for sprinkling
 dry red chilli flakes (paprika) for sprinkling
 8 tbsp grated processed cheese
 4 tbsp nylon sev
 4 tsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
For khakhra chaat
To make 
khakhra chaat
, take a ghee sada khakhra and place on a clean, dry surface.
Put 1 tsp green chutney and ½ tbsp tomato ketchup and spread it evenly.
Top it with 1 tbsp finely chopped onions, 1 tbsp finely chopped capsicum, ½ tbsp finely chopped tomatoes and 1 tbsp boiled corn.
Sprinkle little salt, chaat masala and chilli flakes evenly over it.
Finally sprinkle 2 tbps grated cheese, 1 tbsp sev and 1 tsp finely chopped coriander evenly over it.
Repeat steps 1 to 5 to make 3 more khakhra chaat.
Serve the khakhra chaat immediately.

recipe_long_name: Banana Sheera recipe - How to make Banana Sheera
ingredients:
For Banana Sheera:
 1 cup semolina (rava / sooji)
 1/3 cup ghee
 3/4 cup chopped bananas
 2 cups milk
 1 cup sugar
 2 tbsp chopped mixed nuts
 1 tbsp chironji nuts
 1 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 1/2 tbsp raisins (kismis)
recipe:
For banana sheera
To make 
banana sheera
, heat the ghee in a broad non-stick pan, add the semolina and sauté on a slow flame for 8 to 10 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the mixed nuts, chironji, banana and cardamom powder and mix well and cook on medium flame for a minute.
Add milk and sugar, mix well and cover with a lid and cook on a slow flame for about 10 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the raisins and mix well.
Serve the banana sheera warm.

recipe_long_name: Instant Rice Dhokla recipe - How to make Instant Rice Dhokla
ingredients:
For Instant Rice Dhokla:
 1 cup cooked rice (chawal)
 1/4 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1/3 cup fresh curd (dahi)
 3/4 cup semolina (rava / sooji)
 1 tbsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1 tsp powdered sugar
 2 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp fruit salt
 chilli powder for sprinkling
 freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch) for sprinkling
 For The Tempering:
 1 tbsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
recipe:
For instant rice dhokla
To make 
instant rice dhokla
, in a mixer jar add cooked rice, besan and curd. Blend till smooth.
Transfer into a deep bowl and add semolina, prepared tempering, ginger-green chili paste, powdered sugar, coriander and salt to taste and mix well.
Just before steaming, add the fruit salt to the batter and 1/2 cup water over it, mix gently.
Pour the mixture into a greased 175 mm. (7”) diameter thali and steam in a steamer for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle chilli powder and pepper powder evenly over it.
Remove and keep aside to cool slightly, then cut into wedges.
Serve the instant rice dhokla immediately with green chutney.

recipe_long_name: Bajra Khakhra Using Olive Oil recipe - How to make Bajra Khakhra Using Olive Oil
ingredients:
For Bajra Khakhra:
 3/4 cup bajra (black millet) flour
 3/4 tsp ginger (adrak)
 3/4 tsp crushed garlic (lehsun)
 1 tbsp white sesame seeds (til)
 3 1/2 tsp olive oil
 1/4 tsp salt
recipe:
For bajra khakhra
To make 
bajra khakhra using olive oil
, combine the bajra flour, ginger green chilli paste, garlic, sesame seeds, olive oil and salt.
Add enough hot water and knead well into a firm dough.
Divide the dough into 8 equal portions and roll each on a floured surface into a 125 mm. (5") diameter thin circle.
Heat a tava (griddle), cook one side of the khakhra for 30 seconds, flip, grease with olive oil and repeat on the other side of the khakhra.
Continue cooking the khakhra on a slow flame, while pressing with a khakhra press or a folded muslin cloth, till it turns crisp and golden brown spots appear on both sides.
Repeat for the remaining to make 7 more khakhras.
Serve the bajra khakhra using olive oil as a healthy snack.

recipe_long_name: Instant Poha Premix recipe - How to make Instant Poha Premix
ingredients:
For Instant Poha Premix:
 2 tbsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 8 to 10 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 tsp finely chopped green chillies
 1/4 cup raw peanuts
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 cups roasted beaten rice (poha)
 1 tsp castor sugar
 salt to taste
recipe:
For instant poha premix
To make 
instant poha premix
, heat oil in a broad nonstick pan, add mustard seeds, green chillies, curry leaves and raw peanuts, sauté on medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add turmeric powder and mix well.
Add the roasted poha, sugar and salt to taste, mix well and sauté on medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes.
Allow it to cool completely and store in an air tight container.
To make 1 serving, take ½ cup of the instant poha premix, add 1/4 cup hot water, mix well cover with lid and keep it aside for 5 to 6 minutes.
After 6 minutes mix well and serve it hot garnish with onion, sev and lemon.

recipe_name: How To Cook Kodri, Foxtail Millet, Varagu
recipe_long_name: How To Cook Kodri, Foxtail Millet, Varagu recipe - How to make How To Cook Kodri, Foxtail Millet, Varagu
ingredients:
For How To Cook Kodri:
 1 cup kodri (varagu)
 1 tsp coconut oil or oil
recipe:
For how to cook kodri
To cook 
kodri (foxtail millet, varagu)
, in a bowl put 1 cup kodri ( foxtail millets) with enough water to cover it.
Remove dirt with your fingertips by rubbing the kodri and change water 2 to 3 times to clean the millets.
Drain. Add 2 cups of water.
Cover and soak for 6 hours or overnight.
Transfer the water with soaked millets in a non-stick pan.
Add 1 teaspoon coconut oil or oil. This prevents the millets from becoming soggy and sticky.
Mix well and bring to a boil.
Stir well. Cover and cook on slow flame for 5 minutes till 90% to 95% done.
Take off the flame and cover for 5 to 10 minutes.
Your kodri is cooked to perfection.
Serve cook kodri hot.

Gujarati
Non-stick Pan

recipe_long_name: Ghughra Sandwich recipe - How to make Ghughra Sandwich
ingredients:
For Ghughra Sandwich:
 12 bread slices
 6 tsp green chutney
 3/4 cup soft butter
 1 cup grated processed cheese
 To Be Mixed Into Stuffing:
 1 cup finely chopped capsicum
 1/2 cup finely chopped onions
 1/4 cup finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 1/2 tsp dry red chilli flakes (paprika)
 salt to taste
recipe:
For ghughra sandwich
To make 
ghughra sandwich
, place three slices of bread on a clean dry surface.
Apple 1 tsp butter and 1/2 tsp green chutney on each bread slice.
Put 1/4 of the prepared stuffing on 2 bread slices.
Put 1/4 cup grated cheese over the stuffing and stack them one over the other.
Cover with the third bread slice chutney faced downwards and press gently.
Grease the sandwich maker and place the sandwich.
Apply little butter and cook the sandwich on low open flame until its golden brown and crisp.
Remove and cut it into 2 equal pieces.
Serve the ghughra sandwich hot.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Mumbai Street Food
Quick Evening Snacks
Indian Snacks for Entertaining

recipe_name: Patta Gobi Dhokla, Diabetic and Kidney Friendly
recipe_long_name: Patta Gobi Dhokla, Diabetic and Kidney Friendly recipe - How to make Patta Gobi Dhokla, Diabetic and Kidney Friendly
ingredients:
For Patta Gobi Dhokla:
 1/4 cup urad dal (split black lentils) , soaked for 2 hours and drained
 1/2 cup jowar (white millet)
 2 tbsp besan (bengal gram flour)
 1/4 cup curd (dahi)
 1/2 tsp green chilli paste
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/8 tsp salt or as advised by doctor or dietitian
 1 cup grated cabbage
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania) for garnish
 For The Tempering:
 1 1/2 tsp oil
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 4 to 5 curry leaves (kadi patta)
recipe:
For patta gobi dhokla
To make 
cabbage dhokla
, clean and wash the jowar. Add it to a mixer jar and blend to a coarse powder. Keep aside.
Blend the soaked and drained urad dal along with 3 tbsp of water to a smooth paste. Remove in a deep bowl.
Add coarsely powdered jowar, besan and curd to it and mix well.
Cover with a lid and allow it to ferment for 6 to 8 hours in a warm place.
Once fermented, add the green chilli paste, turmeric powder, salt and cabbage and mix well.
Transfer the batter into a greased thali and steam in the steamer for 12 to 15 minutes or until done.
Remove and cool them slightly.
For the tempering, heat the oil in a small non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the sesame seeds and curry leaves and saute for 10 seconds.
Pour the tempering over the dhokla and spread it evenly.
Cut the dhokla into 15 equal pieces using a sharp knife.
Serve the patta gobi dhokla hot garnished with coriander.

recipe_long_name: Crispy Sabudana Pakoda recipe - How to make Crispy Sabudana Pakoda
ingredients:
For Crispy Sabudana Pakoda:
 2 cups boiled and mashed potatoes
 1/2 cup sago (sabudana)
 1/4 cup roasted and coarsely crushed peanuts
 2 tsp finely chopped green chillies
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/4 cup finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
 oil for deep frying
 For Serving:
 vrat green chutney
recipe:
For crispy sabudana pakoda
To make 
crispy sabudana pakoda recipe
, grind raw sabudana in a mixer jar into a fine powder. Keep aside.
In a deep bowl, add mashed potatoes, sabudana powder, peanuts, green chillies, cumin seeds, coriander and salt to taste. Mix well.
Heat oil in a deep pan, drop a few small portions of the mixture into hot oil.
Deep fry them on medium flame until golden brown and crisp.
Drain on an absorbent paper.
Serve the crispy sabudana pakoda crispy sabudana pakoda
 immediately.

recipe_name: Kuttu ka Paratha, Kuttu ki Roti
recipe_long_name: Kuttu ka Paratha, Kuttu ki Roti recipe - How to make Kuttu ka Paratha, Kuttu ki Roti
ingredients:
For Kuttu ka Paratha:
 1 cup buckwheat (kuttu or kutti no daro) flour
 1/4 cup boiled and mashed potatoes
 1/2 tsp finely chopped green chillies
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 3 tsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 1/2 tsp rock salt (sendha namak)
 3 tsp ghee or oil
 1/4 cup warm water + 1 1/2 tablespoons
recipe:
Dough for kuttu ka paratha
In a bowl put buckwheat flour. Add boiled and mashed potatoes, green chillies, cumin seeds, coriander and rock salt.
Gradually add warm water to make a soft dough. Divide the dough into 6 equal parts and roll into round balls.
Making kuttu ka paratha
Place a large moist muslin cloth on a rolling board. We need a large cloth as we will be covering the dough ball with it for rolling.
Sprinkle a little flour on it.
Flatten the dough ball and sprinkle flour on it.
Cover the dough ball with the other part of the muslin cloth.
Gently roll to a 100 mm ( 4 inches ) circle. While rolling, you will need to rotate the rolling board.
Heat a non-stick pan.
Pick the paratha along with the muslin cloth, place the paratha upside down on the hot tava and gently remove the muslin cloth.
Cook on medium heat for 45 seconds.
Grease the top with ghee.
Flip over and cook the other side for 45 seconds.
Brush with ghee.
Keep on cooking and flipping the 
kuttu ka paratha
 for 1 1/2 minutes or until the paratha is golden brown from both sides.
Serve the kuttu ka paratha kuttu ka paratha
 immediately.

recipe_long_name: Sama Matar Dhokla recipe - How to make Sama Matar Dhokla
ingredients:
For Sama Matar Dhokla:
 1/2 cup sanwa millet (sama) , washed
 3 tbsp urad dal (split black lentils)
 1/8 tsp fenugreek (methi) seeds
 1/2 cup sour curd (dahi)
 1/4 cup coarsely crushed green peas
 1/4 cup grated cabbage
 1 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 2 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt as advised by doctor / dietitian
 1/2 tsp ghee for greasing
 chilli powder for sprinkling
 freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch) for sprinkling
recipe:
For sama matar dhokla
To make 
sama matar dhokla recipe
, soak urad dal and fenugreek seeds for 2 hours in enough water.
Once soaked, drain it and transfer it into a mixer jar along with ¼ cup water and blend till smooth.
In a deep bowl, combine the urad dal paste, sama, curd and ½ cup water. Whisk well and allow it to ferment for 6 to 8 hours.
Once fermented, add the green peas, cabbage, ginger garlic paste, coriander and salt. Mix well.
Grease the dhokla thali using ½ tsp ghee and pour the batter over it.
Sprinkle some black pepper powder and chilli powder over it.
Steam the dhokla in the steamer for 25 to 30 minutes or until done.
Serve sama matar dhokla sama matar dhokla
 hot with green chutney.

recipe_long_name: Doodhi na Rasawala Muthia recipe - How to make Doodhi na Rasawala Muthia
ingredients:
Doodhi na Rasawala Muthia:
 1 cup grated bottle gourd (doodhi / lauki) , squeezed
 1/2 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1/2 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1 tsp finely chopped ginger (adrak)
 1/2 tsp finely chopped green chillies
 1/8 tsp salt
 For The Rassa:
 1 tsp oil
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 a pinch of turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp chilli powder
 1/4 cup sour curd (dahi)
 1/8 tsp salt
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
For doodhi na rasawala muthia
To make 
doodhi na rasawala muthia recipe
, in a small bowl, combine dahi and ½ cup water. Whisk well and keep aside.
Combine grated doodhi, besan, wheat flour, ginger, green chillies and little salt in a deep bowl.
Knead into a soft dough without using water. Divide it into 16 equal portions and roll oval shape muthias. Keep aside.
Heat oil in a deep pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, turmeric powder and chilli powder. Sauté for a few seconds.
Add 2 cups of water and bring it to a boil. Drop the muthias one by one in the boiling water.
Boil them on a medium flame for 12 to 15 minutes until they float on top. Add the curd mixture and little salt.
Mix well and cook on a medium flame for 15 minutes till the rassa thickens, while stirring occasionally.
Serve doodhi na rasawala muthia doodhi na rasawala muthia
 hot garnished with coriander.
